meanings.definition: To speak louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the argument, she outvoiced her brother to make her point.
meanings.sent2: In the choir, the soloist outvoiced the rest of the singers.
meanings.sent3: The little bird outvoiced the big parrot in a singing competition.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to win outvoiced all doubts in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The thunder outvoiced the sound of the rain, echoing through the valley.

meanings.definition: To surpass in volume or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display outvoiced the music playing in the background.
meanings.sent2: The cheers of the crowd outvoiced the noise of the traffic outside.
meanings.sent3: The laughter of the children outvoiced the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: His passion for the project outvoiced any hesitations from the team.
meanings.sent5: The roar of the waterfall outvoiced all other sounds in the serene forest.
